title: Multimodal Reasoning

definitions.Multimodal Reasoning: The ability of a system to reason and make decisions based on multiple types of input, such as text, images, and audio.

summary: The slide presents an example problem related to temporal multimodal reasoning. It features a sequence of images showing a man playing golf and falling to the ground. The problem asks what happens to the man after hitting the ball, with the answer provided in a text box.
